As you are aware, present system of engagement of fee auditors at the PIU/CMU level and their scope of' work are contained in Office Circular No. NHAI/F&A/Toll/03-04 dated 28.5.03 (copy enclosed) Based on the experience gained, the system and the scope of the work have  been   reviewed. It has been decided that more comprehensive   system for engagement of the auditors on the basis of detailed evaluation criteria and revised scope of the work, needs to be implemented s0 as to have suitably qualified and resourceful firms Accordingly, detailed guidelines giving revised procedure and scope of work are enclosed. 2. Concerned Project Directors are authorized to advertise in at least 3 local newspapers (one Hindi, one English and one Regional Language) as per the format given in the enclosed guidelines having wide circulation in relevant area and engage an auditor by constituting a committee consisting of at least three senior most officer including Project Director as the  Chairman of the Committee and an officer dealing with finance and accounts   function if not available in the PIU/CMU, from the nearest PIUICMU or an officer from the HO ) as one of the Members.  In addition; Project Director may also co-opt any other employee. 3 The  PIUICMU shall   inform the appointment of the Local Fee Auditors to the Commercial Operation of Corridor Management Division at Head Office. 4 Under all circumstances, the PIU/CMU must ensure that such auditors are in place from the likely date of commencement of collection of user fee and services of present auditors are discontinued on expiry of their existing term: This issues with the approval of the Competent Authority .
